column5: First time fishing Canada this summer and I am thinking of this scenario. I like to carry my fishing rods in a 4" diameter x 8' rod carrier mounted on my roof rack. I can see where this device could be an inspection issue at the border crossing. I am thinking worst case I would have to dismantle the carrier and show it to the border crossing agent the contents. Anyone have any experiences crossing the border with one of these rod carriers to confirm or deny my assumption or provide any feedback or guidance on this??? Thanks.
It's done all the time by many anglers. No problems.
Have crossed with them for 20+ years, never a problem.
same here, never had it questioned
Thanks guys for the feedback and clarifying that unknown in my mind. Now I can concentrate on more important things like fishing

Only had them checked one time and that was coming back into the states. I asked the Border Guard why out of curiosity and he said that there had been incidents of people bringing booze across that was bought in Canada. That was back when our USA $1 was $1.40 in Canada which made the booze cheap. Mike Kansas
Just keep your drugs out of it and you will be fine. Or just get up a good head of steam and don't stop. Works everytime!
Sadly booze is NEVER cheap here in Canada. at $13.00 bottle of Jim Beam sells here for $37.00
I would expect a full report on how this works out for him including pics!!!
